channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Remove graffiti from cable box, 22nd September
item.description:
You have received a request via Love Clean Streets to remedy an issue within your Service Area Graffiti - Non offensive Lat/Long - 51.4086969, 0.006302 what3words - sudden.these.pills Nearest address - Falcon House, 26 Highland Road, Bromley, BR1 4AD

item.title: Unofficial school?, 22nd September
item.description:
Every week day there is a group of children (range of ages) playing noisily at this address for most of the day, it is noisy for neighbours who work from home
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London

item.title: All paving, kerbs and road cracks from tree, 22nd September
item.description:
Outside 56 to 58, all the paving, kerbs and road are cracking and lifting from the roots of the tree you planted. Entire section needs resurfacing as you keep doing temporary repairs from this tree. Was reported, May, June, July and August. Are you waiting for an accident to happen. Also the white line needs refreshing as does all the yellow lines in West Hallowes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Hallowes, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roof of 3 Gilden Crescent, 22nd September
item.description:
Tree has grown to be touching the roof and side of the building. In the wind it’s causing a loud banging sound and I’m concerned this may lead to damage to the door and outer wall. It’s been getting more pronounced of the past month or so and is becoming serious.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilden Crescent, Gospel Oak, London

item.title: Area coned off nothing happening, 22nd September
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights in place area coned off nobody working there - it's very near a pedestrian crossing - with traffic congestion it's very difficult to see pedestrians waiting to cross and it's very near two schools x the area has been like it for nearly a week has someone forgotten to inform utilities company area is safe to work in ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Station Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: School crossing road markings and sign, 22nd September
item.description:
The "your speed" detection sign, with school crossing signage, is not working - has not worked for 5+ years. Also the adjacent road markings for "SLOW" and the triangle "children crossing" sign are faded and almost gone. Obvious high risk with adjacent school entry near the crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Reckless Driving and Illegal Parking, 22nd September
item.description:
Ear Southwark Council, I am writing to bring an extremely serious and ongoing issue to your attention. A resident of Millpond Estate, SE16, driving a grey/blue BMW with the registration AD69 DDU, is creating a significant hazard for everyone in our community. This individual is habitually parking their car illegally, often blocking the entrance to the estate. This is not only a nuisance but also a serious safety concern, especially for emergency vehicle access. More concerningly, this person drives their vehicle with utter disregard for the safety of others. They are regularly speeding through the narrow streets of Bermondsey Wall East and West Lane, day and night. The combination of excessive speed and loud noise is a constant disturbance and, more importantly, a recipe for a tragic accident. This dangerous behavior has been a continuous problem. We should not have to wait for an accident to occur for action to be taken. I implore you to investigate this matter urgently and take firm and immediate steps to ensure the safety and peace of our neighborhood. Thank you for your attention to this critical issue. Best regards,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5-16, King Edward The Third Mews, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
